title: Re: DOSbox for BioMenace?
content:
I'd recommend not using WinZip, but WinRAR, which support more archive types and is less annoying.

www.winrar.com____________
I have a boring signature.

...
Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site[/url].

title: Re: DOSbox for BioMenace?
content: I trump your WinRAR with [url=http://www.7-zip.org]7-zip[/url], which has the added benefits of a smaller filesize, better compression ratios and no nag messages.

title: Re: DOSbox for BioMenace?
content: I thought 7-zip only supports zip, rar and 7-zip? Not 10000 file types like winrar.

title: Re: DOSbox for BioMenace?
content:
Humm... this might be weird but I find that I can play all the CK games, BioMenace trilogy, Blake Stone (god I love that game), Wolfenstein 3D, and the original Doom games without using DOSBox. My OS is Windows XP but I can still play them. Weird, isn't it? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img]

However, music doesn't play and I'm left with annoying PC Speaker sound effects.

title: Re: DOSbox for BioMenace?
content:
XP is generally better than 2000 at doing DOS games.
I recently upgraded, but I'll continue to use DOSBox for ease of use.
XP doesn't have DOS sound support, so that's why (besides DOSBox) VDMSound is so popular.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: DOSbox for BioMenace?
content: Cheers, I think I'll get DOSbox or VDMSound.  Got any links to a download?

title: Re: DOSbox for BioMenace?
content:
Here's [url=http://dosbox.sourceforge.net/]DOSBox[/url]'s website, which I personally recommend as it's a pretty complete package, and here is [url=http://sourceforge.net/projects/vdmsound/]VDMSound[/url], which like I said only adds audio support.
(Actually the more user-friendly site is [url=http://vdmsound.sourceforge.net/]here[/url], but that's down at the moment, and the temporary mirror/backup/whatever doesn't seem to work anymore either.)
I'm not giving direct download links as you should read some documentation before installing first anyway.

Also don't forgot about [url=http://www.google.com/]Google[/url] to find stuff yourself.
Usually just inputting the name of the program gives you the official site as one of the first, if not the first link.Retodon8
